result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew William Nash was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andrew William Nash is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Andrew William Nash was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Andrew William Nash was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B", Use Dangerous Weapon (Misdemeanor)], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 1.
Defendant to report to Probation by Wednesday October 12, 2016 by 4:00 p.m.
Court notes 14 days credit against any ultimate sentence.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file.
DNA surcharge.
Not to possess any firearms during Probation.

-NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with C. Blue.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Defendant to maintain chemical and mental health treatment and take all prescribed medications.
-Comply with any other programming Agent believes necessary along with counseling with minor child.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Random and regular testing.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

-If Defendant completes AODA Program in the Jail Court may STAY whatever is left of Jail time.

Consecutive to: Count 3

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Angela Raye Olson DF: Andrew William Nash appeared. Case called at 3:54. ADA Nieskes updates the court. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC  to Ct 2 removing the domestic abuse enhancer and NC to Ct 3 removing the domestic abuse enhancer but adding (armed with a dangerous weapon) 939.63 1(a) in 15CF593. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 removing the enhancer  and guilty of Ct 3 removing the enhancer but adding armed with a dangerous weapon in 15CF593. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 15CF593. Sentencing arguments. DE makes a statement. Crt orders: Sentence W/H:
On Ct. 2
2 years probation with conditions:
- DE to have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, C. Blue.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- DE to maintain chemical and mental health treatment and take all perscribed medication. 
 And any other programing agent believes necessary along with counseling with minor child. 
- Costs of $243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge $200.00.
  Apply bond on file. 
- Random and regular testing. 
- De not to possess any firearms during probation. 

On Ct. 3
2 years probation concurrent with Ct. 1
same conditions as Ct. 2
Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.
- Costs of $243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge $200.00.

Court notes 14 days credit against any ultimate sentence. 
DE to report to probation by Wed. 10-12-2016 by 4:00pm. 
Records from Hudson Hospital be sealed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Andrew William Nash
Current: 643 N 3rd St, New Richmond, WI 54017 United States  (Effective: 02-09-2016)
Prior: 1436 182nd Avenue, New Richmond, WI 54017 United States

**AMENDED**

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Cassandra B.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

 - Random and regular testing. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

- No possession of any weapons.

- Parties are not to speak of the case at any time at any place including counseling. 

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

Preliminary hearing at 12-30-2015 10:00 am

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Cassandra B.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-No possession of any weapons.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
